New Records: Jayson Tatum scored 26 points in the first half, almost reaching 30, setting up a dominant performance.
Boston Celtics set a new record with 18 three-pointers made in the game.
Boston Celtics recorded 35 fast break points, a significant advantage over Atlanta.
The Celtics' 30-point victory margin established a new team record for the largest win in the regular season.
Key Match Events: Boston Celtics dominated the first half, leading by 22 points, which was a turning point in the game.
The Celtics' defensive efforts with 15 steals and seven blocks highlighted their dominance.
Atlanta Hawks struggled to trim the deficit, failing to mount a significant comeback.
Post-Match Reflections: Jayson Tatum nearly achieved a triple-double with nine assists, six rebounds, and two steals.
Derrick White and Payton Pritchard contributed significantly to Boston's win with 21 and 18 points respectively.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Boston's fast break dominance and Atlanta's offensive struggles were notable aspects of the game.
